intro: Amsinckiopsis kingii var. harknesii, commonly known as the Harknes' rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are bright yellow and appear in early spring, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and soil stabilization.
